body_html: Yes, that makes sense. There was a similar issue in core TensorFlow when you scheduled k ops that are waiting for dequeue op to run, which deadlocked when inter_op_parallelism_threads is exceeded. That was solved by adding special threads to run dequeue ops that don't respect inter_op_parallelism_threads limit.
body_text: Yes, that makes sense. There was a similar issue in core TensorFlow when you scheduled k ops that are waiting for dequeue op to run, which deadlocked when inter_op_parallelism_threads is exceeded. That was solved by adding special threads to run dequeue ops that don't respect inter_op_parallelism_threads limit.
body: Yes, that makes sense. There was a similar issue in core TensorFlow when you scheduled k ops that are waiting for `dequeue` op to run, which deadlocked when `inter_op_parallelism_threads` is exceeded. That was solved by adding special threads to run `dequeue` ops that don't respect `inter_op_parallelism_threads` limit.
